meanings.definition: The state or quality of being livid.
meanings.sent1: Her face showed signs of lividity after the argument.
meanings.sent2: The lividity of the painting captured everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The lividity of the sky at sunset was breathtaking.
meanings.sent4: The lividity of the situation made it clear that something was wrong.
meanings.sent5: The lividity of the flowers in the garden was striking against the green leaves.

meanings.definition: A discolored, bluish appearance of the skin caused by lack of oxygen.
meanings.sent1: The doctor noted the lividity on the patient's skin.
meanings.sent2: Lividity is a common sign of oxygen deprivation.
meanings.sent3: The lividity on his face made him look like a character from a fantasy movie.
meanings.sent4: The lividity of the bruise was a stark reminder of the accident.
meanings.sent5: The lividity of the water in the pond hinted at pollution in the area.
